item.title: Destiny 2 Warlock Shares Cool Concept for a SIVA Ornament
item.description:
Highlights

  • Destiny 2 fans enjoy game variety with three unique classes and customizable subclasses for a tailored experience.
  • Player creativity shines with custom ornamental designs like a legendary Siva chest piece for Warlocks.

A Destiny 2 fan shared their original concept for a legendary Siva ornament for Warlocks to use. This class lacks a Siva ornament, prompting one creative Destiny 2 fan to design and share their own with the rest of the game's community.

While tight, satisfying gunplay and exhilarating combat encounters are Destiny 2 's bread and butter, fans also enjoy the game for the sheer amount of variety and creativity it allows for. Destiny 2 offers a total of three playable classes for players to pick from, including Hunter, Warlock, and Titan. However, a wide range of subclasses fall between these three main choices, allowing players to customize their experience to their liking. One of the game's main draws is the sheer number of powerful weapons players can acquire, though there are a ton of armor sets fans can get their hands on as well, making fashion a big part of the overall Destiny 2 experience. Players can mix and match various colors and pieces to create their own unique themed characters, with one fan designing their own legendary ornament.

Due to Destiny 2 lacking a legendary Siva ornament for the Warlock class, Reddit user mrHDash_ decided to create their own, sharing their concept with the rest of the game's online community. Players can use Armor Synthesis in Destiny 2 , the game's version of “transmog,” a feature that grants players the ability to use unlocked armor to create Universal Ornaments for a certain class. No legendary Siva ornaments exist for Warlocks currently, but this did not stop a fan from making their own.

Destiny 2 Player Shares Custom Siva Ornament Concept

The concept image shows a Warlock standing tall with a red color scheme, featuring a large metallic chest piece as their Destiny 2 legendary ornament, with the entire getup being inspired by Siva. "I noticed that warlocks lack a legendary Siva ornament," said the fan, "especially something that would fit with the necrotic grips ornament, so I made a chest piece ornament design."

Siva is something longtime Destiny fans will recognize. During the original Destiny 's Rise of Iron expansion, players learned of a long-lost force that humanity had a hand in creating. Siva, the Warmind-creating nanomachines, devoured several Iron Lords but have been notably absent from Destiny 2 despite being relatively popular among the community, with this concept bringing back Siva in an incredibly cool way. In other news, players are still reeling from Destiny 2 's massive The Final Shape expansion, which adds to the game's lore, armor sets and selection of weapons considerably. Designed specifically for fans, The Final Shape takes Destiny 2 to new heights, welcoming all to bear witness to the end of the Light and Darkness saga that started a decade ago.

item.title: The Future of God of War Should Take Notes From Its Past
item.description: With the Norse saga of God of War in the rearview mirror, now is the perfect to time to discuss the future of the franchise. With the future bright, Santa Monica should consider a similar approach to the next games in the series to what they took in 2018.

item.title: Big Xbox Console Exclusive Might Get Delayed To 2025
item.description:
Highlights

  • Avowed is rumored to be delayed to early 2025 to make room for other Xbox Game Pass releases in late 2024.
  • The final few months of 2024 will see the release of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6, Microsoft Flight Simulator, STALKER 2: Heart of Chernobyl, and potentially Indiana Jones and the Great Circle.

Xbox's highly anticipated fantasy RPG Avowed is reportedly being pushed out of 2024, instead aiming for an early 2025 release. One of Xbox's three major triple-A 2024 releases alongside the well-received Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 and the yet-to-be-released Indiana Jones and the Great Circle , Avowed is in development at Obsidian Entertainment, the studio known for acclaimed RPGs like Fallout: New Vegas , Pillars of Eternity , and The Outer Worlds .

Obsidian's first-person fantasy RPG has been making the showcase rounds in the lead-up to its planned release this year. Avowed had a major presence at the Xbox Developer Direct back in January, where Obsidian showed off one of the game's early ocean-themed areas, Shatterscarp. The extended gameplay slice also showcased Avowed 's first-person combat, the ability to wield a combination of different weapons and arms, and some of the game's powerful magic abilities. However, a release window wasn't given until Avowed appeared once again during June's Xbox Games Showcase 2024 with a story trailer, letting Xbox fans know they could expect the game later in 2024.

Now, at the beginning of August, Tom Warren of The Verge has come out with a new Avowed rumor, claiming that Xbox and Obsidian are now looking to delay the fantasy RPG to early 2025. Warren elaborated that this potential delay wouldn't be due to the game not being ready, as he claims the title is "in good shape." Rather, the push would be a way to give other big Xbox Game Pass games more room to shine in a crowded November and December.

Avowed Might Be Delayed To 2025

The final three months of 2024 are stacked for Xbox Game Pass subscribers. Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 will be the first ever Call of Duty title to launch on release day on the service in October. Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 is gearing up for its November 19 release, and just a day later, STALKER 2: Heart of Chornobyl is set to release on November 20. On top of that, current rumors are pinning Indiana Jones and the Great Circle for a release at some point in early December. STALKER 2' s recent delay from September 5 to November 20 may be a leading factor in Xbox's rumored delay of Avowed into 2025.

If Avowed were pushed to next year, many are considering the already massive slate of 2025 Xbox games on the docket. Currently, Doom: The Dark Ages , South of Midnight , and Fable are all officially stamped with 2025 release windows; Gears of War: E-Day and Clockwork Revolution are also rumored to be 2025 titles. Even with all of these major first-party Xbox games filling the 2025 calendar, there may be proper room for Avowed in January or February, as Doom: The Dark Ages may be an April or May title based on the series' past releases. Xbox fans should stay tuned for more news regarding Avowed over the next few months.

item.title: Helldivers 2's Upcoming Massive Factories Will Finally Necessitate One Overkill Stratagem
item.description:
Highlights

  • The upcoming Helldivers 2 update adds a new level 10 difficulty with massive enemies & structures for a tougher challenge.
  • The Orbital 380mm Barrage stratagem, once avoided, could become a valuable tool for tackling level 10 missions.
  • Despite its drawbacks, the destructive power of the stratagem can be a unique and fun addition to gameplay in Helldivers 2.

Helldivers 2 is full of tools for players to use in their fight for galactic freedom and managed democracy. After numerous hours of repeated missions and experimentations, some have crafted the best personal builds to help them fulfill Super Earth's cause. Although players have many different equipment options, some can be considered so powerful that they would be more of a hindrance than a benefit. A particular stratagem in Helldivers 2 is well-known for being one, but the game's upcoming major update may just change its perceived value among the community.

The Escalation of Freedom update coming to Helldivers 2 on the 6th of August 2024 will bring some interesting content. One of the more notable additions would be a new level 10 difficulty that's said to include massive factories and outposts. As amazing as it sounds, the challenge will likely be very tough to complete as it will have more enemies and bigger structural defenses to tackle. But it is because of that the Orbital 380Mm He Barrage could finally be seen as a helpful tool rather than one that's disregarded due to its overly destructive power. The stratagem has the potential to greatly aid players in tackling level 10 missions, but only if it's given the chance to do so.

Why Players Should Use the Orbital 380 Barrage Stratagem in Tackling the Large Factories and Outposts

Normally, the Orbital 380mm Barrage is a stratagem players avoid in Helldivers 2 . Although very powerful and covers a large area when used, the randomness of where the explosions end up usually causes more harm than good. In many cases, it causes the deaths of fellow allies rather than enemies even when properly used, making it more of a liability than an asset. However, the upcoming large factories and outposts could be the best targets to use the stratagem on, and here are a few reasons why:

  • The destructive power and wide area of explosions could get rid of many or even all the dangerous obstacles within the massive enemy settlement
  • The stratagem can be used as a powerful last resort if players are unable to get through the factories or outposts with conventional strategies
  • The long duration of the barrage can allow players to set up everything they need while also dealing massive damage to the humongous target

Some consider the Orbital 380mm Barrage as an underrated but fun stratagem in Helldivers 2 , and the Escalation of Freedom update has the chance to make it more than that. While there's no telling if it will make tackling the upcoming factories and outposts much easier, its destructive benefits will likely encourage players to use it.

Why the Destructive Orbital Stratagem Should Be Used More

Some believe that the Orbital 380mm Barrage shouldn't be used because of its drawbacks, but it is for that reason that it makes a unique and interesting stratagem. Besides being a weapon known for eliminating enemies and allies, it can also create gameplay experiences that no other stratagem can provide. While its destructive power could ruin the chances of completing a mission, it can also do the opposite while adding an extra benefit.

When using it for its intended purpose of removing large spawns of enemies or heavy outposts, it has the potential to create fun and exciting gameplay.The chaos it brings could make combat situations easier or harder to deal with, but its randomness can at least be counted on to produce entertaining results. Although far from being ranked as one of the best stratagems in Helldivers 2 , it is still a powerful tool whose entertaining benefits can outweigh its disadvantages.

The Escalation of Freedom update for Helldivers 2 could elevate the status of the Orbital 380mm Barrage stratagem with its new difficulty and larger enemy settlements. While some will remain hesitant to use the destructive weapon, the upcoming major patch can at least make it be seen as a viable option despite its disadvantages.

item.title: Roots of Pacha Xbox Series X Console Giveaway
item.description:
Highlights

  • You have the chance to win a custom Roots of Pacha-themed Xbox Series X console or digital game codes in Game Rant's giveaway. Open to US residents 18+.
  • Roots of Pacha is a unique co-op farming game set in the Stone Age.
  • Celebrate Roots of Pacha's Xbox debut with this new giveaway.

Game Rant is giving away a custom Roots of Pacha -themed Xbox Series X console to one lucky winner. Plus, 10 runners-up will have the chance to win digital codes for Roots of Pacha on Xbox. This contest is open to anyone in the US who is at least 18 years or older .

Roots of Pacha is a co-op farming and life simulation game that has drawn comparisons to Stardew Valley . The big twist is that the game is set in the Stone Stage, which lends itself to unique scenarios, characters, and items not typically found in farming/life sim games. Roots of Pacha was previously available on PC, PS4, PS5, and Switch, but has now made the jump to Xbox with its big 1.2 update.

To help celebrate the new Roots of Pacha update and the game's debut on Xbox consoles, Game Rant is hosting a giveaway where 1 (ONE) lucky winner will receive a customized Xbox Series X console adorned with Roots of Pacha art, while 10 (TEN) runners-up will get digital codes for the game. The giveaway is open until 11:59 PM PT on August 8.

How to Enter the Roots of Pacha Xbox Console Giveaway

Roots of Pacha boasts crossplay support, so those on Xbox can play with their friends on other platforms. The 1.2 update is the perfect time to jump in to the critically-acclaimed life sim, as new features have been added to the mix. Among the new features in the latest Roots of Pacha update are the ability to raise children and send them to school, new customization options for the protagonist, new technologies to invent, and new mounts, like mammoths, spiders, cave lions, and wolves. Additionally, the latest Roots of Pacha update has made various quality of life changes, with UI-free screenshots, new sorting methods, faster resource processing methods, and more.

Roots of Pacha is out now for PC, PS4, PS5, Switch, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X. This Roots of Pacha Xbox Series X console giveaway is live now and ends on Thursday, August 8 at 11:59 PM PT.
